movie_title: Rhetoric: How persuasive are you? - 6 Minute English
introduction: The art of rhetoric started with the ancient Greek philosophers. Later, during the Roman republic, p

vocabulary.definition: the art of using language effectively and persuasively
vocabulary.example: The politician's speech was filled with powerful rhetoric to sway the audience.

vocabulary.definition: a short sentence or phrase designed to be easily remembered
vocabulary.example: The politician's campaign was successful due to his catchy soundbites.

vocabulary.definition: a proposition used as evidence in an argument
vocabulary.example: The premise of the debate was whether technology has more benefits than drawbacks.

vocabulary.definition: strongly attacking or defending a particular opinion or idea
vocabulary.example: The author's article was highly polemical, sparking intense debates among readers.

vocabulary.definition: to come together in support of a common goal
vocabulary.example: The community rallied to raise funds for the local school.
The con artist used various tactics to deceive people into giving him money.
